title: Kenmare Resources First Half 2025 Earnings: EPS Beats Expectations, Revenues Lag
description: Kenmare Resources ( LON:KMR ) First Half 2025 Results Key Financial Results Revenue: US$167.7m (up 1.6% from 1H 2024...
content:
• Net loss: US$94.2m (down from US$20.9m profit in 1H 2024).
• US$1.06 loss per share (down from US$0.23 profit in 1H 2024).

Trump has pledged to "unleash" American oil and gas and these 15 US stocks have developments that are poised to benefit.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

Revenue missed analyst estimates by 2.9%. Earnings per share (EPS) exceeded analyst estimates by 5.4%.

Looking ahead, revenue is forecast to grow 4.1% p.a. on average during the next 3 years, compared to a 1.9% growth forecast for the Metals and Mining industry in the United Kingdom.

Performance of the British Metals and Mining industry.

The company's shares are down 3.0% from a week ago.

Don't forget that there may still be risks. For instance, we've identified 1 warning sign for Kenmare Resources that you should be aware of.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.



This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
summary: Kenmare Resources, a company that produces oil and gas, reported a 5.4% increase in Q1 2025 earnings compared to 2.9% for the same period. The company's revenue is expected to grow by 4.1% p.m. on average over the next three years, compared to the UK's 1.9%. However, there are still risks, with shares down 3.0% from a week ago.
shortSummary: Kenmare Resources reported a loss of US$94.2m, despite better-than-expected earnings, amid ongoing concerns about potential Russian intervention in the US oil industry.

scraped_sources.text:
Results
22
Midstream oil and gas companies, specifically pipeline operators, are well-positioned to benefit from Trump’s executive orders on fossil fuels enacted in early 2025. – – These policies aim to accelerate infrastructure development by streamlining environmental reviews and permitting processes, such as those under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA). The declaration of a "national energy emergency" further empowers these companies by prioritizing pipeline and storage projects to support increased production from newly accessible federal lands and waters. – – The push to "unleash American energy" also amplifies demand for midstream services as upstream production ramps up, particularly in regions like Alaska and offshore areas reopened for drilling. Pipelines and storage facilities will be critical to moving larger volumes of oil and gas efficiently, especially with the renewed emphasis on LNG exports to meet global demand.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1972 | 1,761 | Tom Hickey | www.kenmareresources.com |
Kenmare Resources plc, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the production and sale of mineral sand products in China, rest of Asia, Europe, the United States, and internationally. The company operates the Moma Titanium Minerals Mine located on the northeast coast of Mozambique. Its products include ilmenite, rutile, and zircon; monazite; and concentrates, including secondary zircon, mineral sand concentrates, and ZrTi.

argos_summary: The article reports a sharp reversal from a $20.9 m profit in H1 2024 to a $94.2 m net loss in the trailing 12 months, with EPS falling from a profit to a $1.06 loss. It highlights how Trump’s 2025 fossil‑fuel executive orders are expected to boost midstream oil and gas companies, listing 22 US firms that could benefit from accelerated pipeline and LNG projects. The UK metals and mining sector has seen modest revenue growth (≈4 % p.a.) but a 3.5 % decline in earnings over the past year, while Kenmare Resources is forecast to turn profitable in three years with earnings growth of 92 % and EPS growth of 110 %. Overall, the piece underscores regulatory support for energy infrastructure and mixed outlooks for individual companies and the broader metals industry.
